item.title: Problem 5: Smallest multiple
item.description: Problem 2520 is the smallest number that can be divided by each of the numbers from 1 to 10 without any remainder. What is the smallest positive number that is evenly divisible by all of the numbers from 1 to 20? Explanation This problem boils down to finding the least common multiple of all numbers from 1 to 20. âŠ•The least common multiple, or LCM, of two integers \(a\) and \(b\) is the smallest positive integer that is divisible by both \(a\) and \(b\).
